concept.title: Viewing Pipeline Types in Data Collector

conbody.p: Let's look at a sample Home page to see how displays local pipelines, published pipelines, and DPM controlled pipelines:

ul.li: Local pipeline that was developed in this and can be run locally on this . Local pipelines are listed by name. In the image above, Remove Extra Fields is a local pipeline that is not running. The Remove Extra Fields pipeline has not been published to , as indicated by no version number after its name.

Published pipeline that was published to and can still be run locally on this . Published pipelines are listed by name and version number. In the image above, Kafka to HDFS is a published pipeline that is not running.
Running published pipeline that was published to , then run from a job. Published pipelines that are remotely run from jobs are named as follows:<pipeline name>:<job ID>

Running system pipeline that collects, aggregates, and pushes metrics for all of the remote pipeline instances run from the job. Running system pipelines are named as follows:System Pipeline for Job <job name>:<system job ID>

conbody.note: In the image above, the job was started on a used to design pipelines. As a best practice, use labels within to separate development s from production s. That way, you can ensure that published pipelines are only run on production s and not on a that a developer is currently using to design pipelines. For more information about using labels, see the online help.
